In 2015, it was the  norovirus scare.

And now...https://www.cnn.com/2021/05/25/business/chipotle-food-...

What do you think is going on?

..
This week, more news:

"Chipotle Mexican Grill's (CMG.N) struggles with food safety were amplified on Wednesday as the company said it had taken action to address two separate incidents at restaurants in Massachusetts... (one)... caused by Clostridium perfringens...

A customer posted pictures online of mice scurrying around the floor...
[The CEO] also acknowledged reports that another restaurant... had 'unusually high' rates of customer complaint reports..."

**Whoa** That CLO (no.3 mouse scurry in parentheses) stock just dropped!

And, that's without going into recent incidents like an attempted robbery with guns drawn where a manager [stood calmly behind the counter](https://www.wboc.com/story/39434422/watch-video-shows-manager-calmly-confronting-gunmen-duringchipotle-heist)

Meanwhile, today comes news they're part of a multi-state Cyclosporiasis outbreak

Now what I ask you is: How much does brand loyalty go before people draw the line?
